IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Regional works exclusively with individuals needing mental health care and interventions for substance abuse, by providing comprehensive and community based mental health and substance abuse treatment for adults, and adolescents.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Regional WORKS EXCLUSIVELY WITH INDIVIDUALS NEEDING MENTAL HEALTH CARE AND INTERVENTIONS FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE, BY PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE AND COMMUNITY BASED MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT FOR ADULTS, AND ADOLESCENTS.
IRS990.Description: OUTPATIENT CARE-THESE PROGRAMS OFFER A WIDE RANGE OF COUNSELING SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, COUPLES AND GROUPS. THE FOCUS IS ON SELF-EXPLORATION, EXPRESSIONS OF FEELINGS, SHARING AND PERSONAL PROBLEMS, BUILDING BETTER RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHERS AND STRENGTHENING FAMILY STABILITY.FISCAL YEAR 2010 HOURS OF SERVICE: 91,657

Activity2.Description: CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES/ COMMUNITY SUPPORT-THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE INTENSIVE, THERAPEUTIC CASE MANAGEMENT. THESE PROGRAMS ARE TARGETED TO THOSE WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY DEVELOPING FRIENDSHIPS, PURSUING EMPLOYMENT, AND PLANNING FOR UPCOMING EVENTS. THE COMMUNITY SUPPORT PROGRAM HELPS TO EASE CLIENTS BACK INTO A SATISFACTORY LIVING ROUTINE.FISCAL YEAR 2010 HOURS OF SERVICE: 112,716 AND 171,337 VISITS.

Activity3.Description: RESIDENTIAL CARE-THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE RESDENTIAL HOUSING FOR ADULTS. RESIDENTIAL SERVICES ARE UTILIZED AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO HOSPITALIZATION, AND SERVE THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO REQUIRE HELP IN ACHIEVING SOCIAL AND INDEPENDENT LIVING SKILLS TO SUCCESSFULLY RETURN TO COMMUNITY LIFE. THE PROGRAMS PROVIDE ROOM, BOARD, COUNSELING AND TRAINING IN ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING.FISCAL YEAR 2010 DAYS OF SERVICE: 68,937

ActivityOther.Description: PARTIAL DAY CARE-THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE A FULL-DAY OR HALF-DAY, TREATMENT, WHICH INCLUDES INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP COUNSELING, OCCUPATIONAL AND SKILLS DEVELOPMENT THERAPY AND SOCIALIZATION. THERAPY IS ARRANGED TO ALLOW THE CLIENT TO LIVE AS NORMAL A LIFESTYLE AS POSSIBLE, INCLUDING THE OPPORTUNITY FOR THE CLIENT TO MAINTAIN HIS/HER EMPLOYMENT OR EDUCATION WHILE IN TREATMENT.FISCAL YEAR 2010 HOURS OF SERVICE: 210,826

INPATIENT CARE-THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES MEDICAL, PSYCHOLOGICAL, NURSING CARE AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE DETOXIFICATION TO MENTAL ILL INDIVIDUALS AND SUBSTANCE ABUSERS IN IT'S LOCKED INPATIENT FACILITY AND ON A CONTRACTED UNIT AT A LOCAL HOSPITAL.FISCAL YEAR 2010 DAYS OF SERVICE: 5,913

CONSULTATION AND EDUCATION-THESE PROGRAMS SERVE AS A LINK BETWEEN SOUTHLAKE AND THE COMMUNITY, AND FOCUS ON PROMOTING POSITIVE MENTAL HEALTH AND PREVENTION OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL ILLNESS. VARIOUS PROGRAMS ARE AVAILABLE WHICH SERVE TO INCREASE THE COMMUNITY'S KNOWLEDGE AND ACCEPTANCE OF MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF SKILLS.FISCAL YEAR 2010 HOURS OF SERVICE: 343

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization is an agent for Held funds for patients - representative payee accounts.

Part XI, XII, and XIII are not required as the organization is part of a consolidated financial statement. The consolidated financial statements are audited by an independent accounting firm and prepared in accordance with Generally accepted accounting principles.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.IncomeBasedCriteria: Part I, Line 3c: Free care and discounts beyond those on the discounted care formula would be granted on a case by case basis. The most important element in considering additional fee reduction is the amount of services already consumed and the amount of services still required. Additional discounts and fee reductions would usually not be warranted for individuals needing only occasional outpatient care. However, additional fee reductions would be considered for individual needing daily intensive services and without 3rd party funding assistance.Line 3a - Other % - free care only given on a case by case basisLine 3b - Other % - discount could be given on an exception basis beyond 200% of poverty
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PercentOfTotalExpenseExpln: Part I, Line 7f: Total bad debt expense included on Form 990, Part IX, line 25, column (A) has been excluded from the denominator for the percentage calculation per IRS instructions
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: Footnote to organization's financial statements that describes bad debt expenses: The allowances offset against client accounts receivable represents management's estimate of the expected losses to be realized, and is based on historical experience, current economic conditions, and other relevant factors.Estimated cost to charge ratio and applied percentage to total bad debt expense included in Form 990, Part IX, line 25. The organization estimated 80% of bad debt at cost is attributable to patients eligible under the organization's charity care policy.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: The source used to determine the amount of Medicare allowable costs reported for Part III, Section B, Medicare has been provided from the Year Ended June 30, 2009 report: Hospital Statement of Reimbursable Cost.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: Regional provides care to clients who meet certain criteria under its charity care policy without charge or at amounts less than its established rates. Since Regional does not pursue collection of amounts determined to qualify as charity care, those amounts are not reported as net client service revenue. Charity care provided in 2010 and 2009 was approximately $3,080,772 and $3,749,000 respectively.Part IV - Management Companies and Joint Ventures listing. All joint ventures are 100% owned by Regional Mental Health Center. HUD 811 Residence is the primary activity for Tri-City Residential, Southlake Residential, Watertower Residential, Watertower West Residential, Bell Tower Residential, and Bell Tower North Residential. Geminus activities include Head Start, ASO, Prevention Services, and Managed care. Lake Park RBA's primary activity is indigent room, board, and assistance.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NumberOfFacilityTypeExpln: Part V: In addition to the Psychiatric Hospital, Regional Mental Health Center has 2 community mental health centers, 7 Licensed supervised group living facilities, 11 semi-independent living facilities, and 7 outpatient counseling clinics.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: Community needs assessments are conducted periodically.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: Every patient participates in a financial interview process where the organization's fee assistance program is described, along with other client rights issues. Every patient is given a "Client Handbook" which describes the Center's financial policies, privacy standards and any assitance programs available.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: Regional Mental Health Center has been assigned the primary service area of Lake County, Indiana except for the City of Gary. Citizens who reside anywhere in the State of Indiana will be served at Regional Mental Health Center if they choose.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: Part VI, Line 5: Fiscal Year 2010 Community Building Activities were to expand the residential living oportunities for persons with Severe and Persistent Mental Illness.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: The Board member composition is community based and self perpetuating. The Board attempts to include members from all regions of the catchment area. Board membership attempts to represent providers and consumers with expertise in legal, finance, education, law enforcement and judiciary.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.AffiliatedHealthCareSystem: Part VI, Line 7: The organization is not part of an affiliated health care system.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The organization pays dues for all employees to have access to a health club.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: Facility renovation; remodeling & equipment purchase; Refinance 1999 bonds

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization is organized as a nonprofit corporation with a board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CFO reviews and copy of the form 990 is presented/provided to the board of directors for review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board is educated about policy at annual combined board retreat. All board members are required to sign a conflict of interest statement annually. Members are asked to recuse themselves if they are in any conflict with the matter being reviewed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The President/CEO is evaluated by the board of directors evaluation committees. Information about performance, comparable data and any other information requested is provided. The committee recommendation is reviewed and acted upon by the full board at the next regular meeting. Other employees have job descriptions and annual reviews by their supervisor, which are documented in each employee's personnel file.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization will make the governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The board of directors assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of the financial statements and selection of the independent accountant; no processes have changed from prior year.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Low income housing for residents of group homes for the mentally ill
Low income housing for residents of group homes for the mentally ill
Low income housing for residents of group homes for the mentally ill
Low income housing for residents of group homes for the mentally ill
Development of collaborative relationships in Social Service programs
Low income housing for residents of group homes for the mentally ill
